titleStmt.title: The prophesie of Haggai, interpreted and applyed in sundry sermons by the famous and judicious divine, John Rainolds, D.D. Never before printed, beeing very usefull for these times.
titleStmt.author: Rainolds, John, 1549-1607.

titleStmt.title: The prophesie of Haggai, interpreted and applyed in sundry sermons by the famous and judicious divine, John Rainolds, D.D. Never before printed, beeing very usefull for these times.
titleStmt.author: Rainolds, John, 1549-1607.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W.W. for William Lee, and are to be sold at the Turkes-head neere the Miter Taverne in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: A1v contains a portrait of John Rainolds.
Pagination and signatures irregular. Pp. 33-34 appear to be another setting of pp.25-26. Pp. 89-96 repeated in page numbering only.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
